senses.synonym: 07896943-n (a flour tortilla folded around a filling)

relations.target: cheese=01525792-v (wind onto a cheese; \""cheese the yarn\"");02686501-v (used in the imperative (get away, or stop it); \""Cheese it!\"");07866305-n (a solid food prepared from the pressed curd of milk);12192020-n (erect or decumbent Old World perennial with axillary clusters of rosy-purple flowers; introduced in United States

bean=01403510-v (hit on the head, especially with a pitched baseball);05547087-n (informal terms for a human head);07740688-n (any of various edible seeds of plants of the family Leguminosae used for food);12576812-n (any of various leguminous plants grown for their edible seeds and pods);13157075-n (any of various seeds or fruits that are beans or resemble beans

meat=05929717-n (the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience; \""the gist of the prosecutor's argument\""; \""the heart and soul of the Republican Party\""; \""the nub of the story\"");07665463-n (the flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food);13157787-n (the inner and usually edible part of a seed or grain or nut or fruit stone; \""black walnut kernels are difficult to get out of the shell\""

filling=00403343-n (the act of filling something);03343232-n ((dentistry) a dental appliance consisting of any of various substances (as metal or plastic) inserted into a prepared cavity in a tooth; \""when he yawned I could see the gold fillings in his teeth\""; \""an informal British term for `filling' is `stopping'\"");04606292-n (the yarn woven across the warp yarn in weaving);07899006-n (a food mixture used to fill pastry or sandwiches etc.);13501744-n (flow into something (as a container));14892394-n (any material that fills a space or container; \""there was not enough fill for the trench\""

wrapped=00165213-a (giving or marked by complete attention to; \""that engrossed look or rapt delight\""; \""enwrapped in dreams\""; \""so intent on this fantastic...narrative that she hardly stirred\""- Walter de la Mare; \""rapt with wonder\""; \""wrapped in thought\"");01699958-a (covered with or as if with clothes or a wrap or cloak; \""leaf-clothed trees\""; \""fog-cloaked meadows\""; \""a beam draped with cobwebs\""; \""cloud-wrapped peaks\"");02094739-a (enclosed securely in a covering of paper or the like; \""gaily wrapped gifts\""
tortilla=07896558-n (thin unleavened pancake made from cornmeal or wheat flour)

flour=07584671-n (fine powdery foodstuff obtained by grinding and sifting the meal of a cereal grain);00382167-v (convert grain into flour);01264514-v (cover with flour; \""flour fish or meat before frying it\""

dish=00433821-n (an activity that you like or at which you are superior; \""chemistry is not my cup of tea\""; \""his bag now is learning to play golf\""; \""marriage was scarcely his dish\"");03211629-n (a piece of dishware normally used as a container for holding or serving food; \""we gave them a set of dishes for a wedding present\"");03212026-n (directional antenna consisting of a parabolic reflector for microwave or radio frequency radiation);07572999-n (a particular item of prepared food; \""she prepared a special dish for dinner\"");10633512-n (a very attractive or seductive looking woman);13789036-n (the quantity that a dish will hold; \""they served me a dish of rice\"");00264357-v (make concave; shape like a dish);01182648-v (provide (usually but not necessarily food); \""We serve meals for the homeless\""; \""She dished out the soup at 8 P.M.\""; \""The entertainers served up a lively show\""
Mexican=09742054-n (a native or inhabitant of Mexico);03038416-a (of or relating to Mexico or its inhabitants; \""Mexican food is hot\""

senses.definition: a Mexican dish consisting of a flour tortilla wrapped around a filling of meat and/or beans, cheese etc
